content.p1: The standard missile is the base #link:missile# size in ICBM. It can carry a #link:payload# of 20 #link:explosives# in its #link:warhead#.
content.p2: Crafting is very unique for the standard missile to help balance it's explosive power. In order to make on of these missiles you need a #launcher that support crafting or a #workstation for the missile size.
content.p3: In order to craft the missile you will need 128 #link:ironRods#, 36 #link:ironPlates#, a #link:guidanceSystem#, a #link:rocketEngine#, a #link:warhead#, and a supported #link:wrench#.

list.entry1: First build a #standardLauncher frame with nothing loaded
list.entry2: Once built start by insert the rods to create the frame. This can be done by right click the CPU or frame once started.

When the frame is completed insert the #link:rocketEngine#, #link:guidanceSystem#, and #link:warhead#. It should visually render each as it is inserted to note the step is completed. #link:Warhead# can optionally be ignored but can not be inserted after the next step.
list.entry3: After inserting the guts of the #link:missile# place the #link:plates# onto the frame as the #link:missile# skin.
list.entry4: With everything added shift right-click the #missile or #link:launcherCPU# to complete the #link:missile#.
